@roblox/globaltype/WebSocket.documentation: The WebSocket class provides a simple interface for sending and receiving data over a WebSocket connection.
@roblox/globaltype/WebSocket.code_sample:
local ws = WebSocket.connect("ws://localhost:8080")

ws.OnMessage:Connect(function(message)
	print(message)
end)

ws.OnClose:Connect(function()
	print("Closed")
end)

ws:Send("Hello, World!")

@roblox/global/WebSocket.connect.documentation: Establishes a WebSocket connection to the specified URL.

@roblox/global/WebSocket.Send.documentation: Sends a message over the WebSocket connection.

@roblox/global/WebSocket.OnMessage.documentation: Fired when a message is received over the WebSocket connection.

@roblox/global/WebSocket.OnClose.documentation: Fired when the WebSocket connection is closed.

@global/Drawing.documentation: The Drawing class provides an interface for drawing shapes and text above the game window.
@global/Drawing.code_sample:
local circle = Drawing.new("Circle")
circle.Radius = 50
circle.Color = Color3.fromRGB(255, 0, 0)
circle.Filled = true
circle.Visible = true

@global/Drawing.new.documentation: Returns a new drawing object of the specified type.
@global/Drawing.new.code_sample:
local circle = Drawing.new("Circle")
circle.Radius = 50
circle.Visible = true

@global/Drawing.Fonts.documentation: A table containing the available font names. The style of each font varies depending on the executor.
@global/Drawing.Fonts.code_sample:
for name, font in pairs(Drawing.Fonts) do
	local text = Drawing.new("Text")
	text.Text = "The quick brown fox (" .. name .. ")"
	text.Font = font
	text.Size = 48
	text.Position = Vector2.new(150, 100 + font * 50)
	text.Visible = true
end

@globaltype/BaseDrawing.documentation: The base class of which all drawing objects inherit. Cannot be instantiated.

@globaltype/BaseDrawing.Visible.documentation: Whether the drawing is visible. Defaults to false on some executors.

@globaltype/BaseDrawing.ZIndex.documentation: Determines the order in which a Drawing renders relative to other drawings.

@globaltype/BaseDrawing.Transparency.documentation: The opacity of the drawing (1 is opaque, 0 is transparent).

@globaltype/Line.documentation: Renders a line starting at From and ending at To.

@globaltype/Line.From.documentation: The starting point of the line.

@globaltype/Line.To.documentation: The ending point of the line.

@globaltype/Text.TextBounds.documentation: The size of the text. Cannot be set.

@globaltype/Text.Center.documentation: Whether the text should be centered horizontally.

@globaltype/Text.Outline.documentation: Whether the text should be outlined.

@globaltype/Image.documentation: Draws the image data to the screen. Data must be the raw image data.

@globaltype/Circle.documentation: Draws a circle that is centered at Position.

@globaltype/Circle.NumSides.documentation: The number of sides of the circle.

@globaltype/Circle.Position.documentation: The position of the center of the circle.

@globaltype/Circle.Thickness.documentation: If Filled is false, specifies the thickness of the outline.

@globaltype/Circle.Filled.documentation: Whether the circle should be filled.

@globaltype/Square.documentation: Draws a rectangle starting at Position and ending at Position + Size.

@globaltype/Square.Position.documentation: The position of the top-left corner of the square.

@globaltype/Square.Thickness.documentation: If Filled is false, specifies the thickness of the outline.

@globaltype/Square.Filled.documentation: Whether the square should be filled.

@globaltype/Quad.documentation: Draws a four-sided figure connecting to each of the four points.

@globaltype/Quad.Thickness.documentation: If Filled is false, specifies the thickness of the outline.

@globaltype/Quad.Filled.documentation: Whether the quad should be filled.

@globaltype/Triangle.documentation: Draws a triangle connecting to each of the three points.

@globaltype/Triangle.Thickness.documentation: If Filled is false, specifies the thickness of the outline.

@globaltype/Triangle.Filled.documentation: Whether the triangle should be filled.

@global/cleardrawcache.documentation: Destroys every drawing object in the cache. Invalidates references to the drawing objects.
@global/cleardrawcache.code_sample:
for i = 1, 10 do
	local circle = Drawing.new("Circle")
	circle.Radius = 50
	circle.Color = Color3.fromRGB(255, 0, 0)
	circle.Filled = true
	circle.NumSides = 32
	circle.Position = Vector2.new(math.random(300, 1200), math.random(300, 1200))
	circle.Transparency = 0.7
	circle.Visible = true
end

task.wait(1)
cleardrawcache()

@global/getrenderproperty.documentation: Gets the value of a property of a drawing. Functionally identical to drawing[property].

@global/isrenderobj.documentation: Returns whether the given object is a valid Drawing.

@global/setrenderproperty.documentation: Sets the value of a property of a drawing. Functionally identical to drawing[property] = value.

@roblox/global/crypt.base64encode.documentation: Encodes a string of bytes into Base64.
@roblox/global/crypt.base64encode.code_sample:
local base64 = crypt.base64encode("Hello, World!")
local raw = crypt.base64decode(base64)

print(base64) --> SGVsbG8sIFdvcmxkIQ==
print(raw) --> Hello, World!

@roblox/global/crypt.base64decode.documentation: Decodes a Base64 string to a string of bytes.
@roblox/global/crypt.base64decode.code_sample:
local base64 = crypt.base64encode("Hello, World!")
local raw = crypt.base64decode(base64)

print(base64) --> SGVsbG8sIFdvcmxkIQ==
print(raw) --> Hello, World!

@roblox/global/crypt.encrypt.documentation: Encrypts an unencoded string using AES encryption. Returns the base64 encoded and encrypted string, and the IV. If an AES IV is not provided, a random one will be generated for you, and returned as a 2nd base64 encoded string. The cipher modes are 'CBC', 'ECB', 'CTR', 'CFB', 'OFB', and 'GCM'. The default is 'CBC'.

@roblox/global/crypt.decrypt.documentation: Decrypts the base64 encoded and encrypted content. Returns the raw string. The cipher modes are 'CBC', 'ECB', 'CTR', 'CFB', 'OFB', and 'GCM'.

@roblox/global/crypt.generatebytes.documentation: Generates a random sequence of bytes of the given size. Returns the sequence as a base64 encoded string.
@roblox/global/crypt.generatebytes.code_sample:
local bytes = crypt.generatebytes(16)
print(bytes) --> bXlzcWwgYm9vbGVhbnM=
print(#crypt.base64decode(bytes)) --> 16

@roblox/global/crypt.generatekey.documentation: Generates a base64 encoded 256-bit key. The result can be used as the second parameter for the `crypt.encrypt` and `crypt.decrypt` functions.

@roblox/global/crypt.hash.documentation: Returns the result of hashing the data using the given algorithm. Some algorithms include 'sha1', 'sha384', 'sha512', 'md5', 'sha256', 'sha3-224', 'sha3-256', and 'sha3-512'.

@roblox/globaltype/crypt.documentation: The crypt library provides methods for the encryption and decryption of string data. Behavior and examples documented are based on Script-Ware.

@roblox/global/crypt.base64.encode.documentation: Alias for `crypt.base64encode`. Encodes a string of bytes into Base64.

@roblox/global/crypt.base64_encode.documentation: Alias for `crypt.base64encode`. Encodes a string of bytes into Base64.

@roblox/global/base64.encode.documentation: Alias for `crypt.base64encode`. Encodes a string of bytes into Base64.

@roblox/global/base64_encode.documentation: Alias for `crypt.base64encode`. Encodes a string of bytes into Base64.

@roblox/global/crypt.base64.decode.documentation: Alias for `crypt.base64decode`. Decodes a Base64 string to a string of bytes.

@roblox/global/crypt.base64_decode.documentation: Alias for `crypt.base64decode`. Decodes a Base64 string to a string of bytes.

@roblox/global/base64.decode.documentation: Alias for `crypt.base64decode`. Decodes a Base64 string to a string of bytes.

@roblox/global/base64_decode.documentation: Alias for `crypt.base64decode`. Decodes a Base64 string to a string of bytes.

@roblox/global/debug.documentation: The debug library is an extension of the Luau debug library, providing greater control over Luau functions.

@roblox/global/debug.getconstant.documentation: Returns the constant at `index` in the constant table of the function or level `func`. Throws an error if the constant does not exist.
@roblox/global/debug.getconstant.code_sample:
local function foo()
    print("Hello, world!")
end

print(debug.getconstant(foo, 1)) --> "print"
print(debug.getconstant(foo, 2)) --> nil
print(debug.getconstant(foo, 3)) --> "Hello, world!"

@roblox/global/debug.getconstants.documentation: Returns the constant table of the function or level `func`. Traversing the table with `ipairs` is not recommended, as constants can be nil or skipped entirely.
@roblox/global/debug.getconstants.code_sample:
local function foo()
    local num = 5000 .. 50000
    print("Hello, world!", num, warn)
end

for i, v in pairs(debug.getconstants(foo)) do
    print(i, v)
end
--> 1 50000
--> 2 "print"
--> 4 "Hello, world!"
--> 5 "warn"

@roblox/global/debug.getinfo.documentation: Returns debugger information about a function or stack level. Some executors are missing certain fields.
@roblox/global/debug.getinfo.code_sample:
local function foo()
    print("Hello, world!")
end

for k, v in pairs(debug.getinfo(foo)) do
    print(k, v, "(" .. type(v) .. ")")
end

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.documentation: A table containing information about a function or stack level, returned by `debug.getinfo`.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.source.documentation: The name of the chunk that created the function.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.short_src.documentation: A 'printable' version of source to be used in error messages.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.what.documentation: The string 'Lua' if the function is a Luau function, or 'C' if it is a C function.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.currentline.documentation: The current line where the given function is executing. When no line information is available, currentline is set to -1.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.name.documentation: The name of the function. If it cannot find a name, then name is a blank string.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.nups.documentation: The number of upvalues in the function.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.numparams.documentation: The number of parameters in the function (always 0 for C functions).

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.is_vararg.documentation: Whether the function has a variadic argument (1 if it does, 0 if it does not).

@roblox/global/debug.getproto.documentation: Returns the proto at `index` in the function or level `func` if `active` is false. If `active` is true, then every active function of the proto is returned. In some executors, the proto is non-functional if `active` is false. Debug information is preserved.
@roblox/global/debug.getproto.code_sample:
local function myFunction()
    local function proto()
        print("Hello, world!")
    end
end

local proto = debug.getproto(myFunction, 1, true)[1]
proto() --> Hello, world!

@roblox/global/debug.getprotos.documentation: Returns a list of protos of the function or level `func`. In some executors, the proto is non-functional, but debug information is preserved.
@roblox/global/debug.getprotos.code_sample:
local function myFunction()
    local function _1()
        print("Hello,")
    end
    local function _2()
        print("world!")
    end
end

for i in ipairs(debug.getprotos(myFunction)) do
    local proto = debug.getproto(myFunction, i, true)[1]
    proto()
end
--> Hello,
--> world!

@roblox/global/debug.getstack.documentation: Returns the value at `index` in the stack frame `level`. Throws an error if no value could be found. If `index` is not specified, then the entire stack frame is returned.
@roblox/global/debug.getstack.code_sample:
local _ = "a" .. "b"
print(debug.getstack(1, 1)) --> ab

local _ = "a" .. "b"
table.foreach(debug.getstack(1), print)
--> ab
--> table.foreach()
--> debug.getstack()
--> 1

@roblox/global/debug.getupvalue.documentation: Returns the upvalue at `index` in the function or level `func`. Throws an error if the upvalue does not exist. An upvalue is a local variable used by an inner function. Some Luau optimizations automatically inline certain constants like strings and integers; they can be retrieved through `debug.getconstant` instead.
@roblox/global/debug.getupvalue.code_sample:
local upvalue = function ()
end

local function foo()
    print(upvalue)
end

print(debug.getupvalue(foo, 1)) --> upvalue

@roblox/global/debug.getupvalues.documentation: Returns a list of upvalues of the function or level `func`. Traversing the table with `ipairs` is not recommended, as upvalues can be nil or skipped entirely.
@roblox/global/debug.getupvalues.code_sample:
local upvalue1, upvalue2 = function () end, function () end

local function foo()
    print(upvalue1, upvalue2)
end

for k, v in pairs(debug.getupvalues(foo)) do
    print(k, v, "(" .. type(v) .. ")")
end
--> 1 upvalue1() (function)
--> 2 upvalue2() (function)

@roblox/global/debug.setconstant.documentation: Sets the constant at `index` in the function or level `func` to `value`. The type of `value` must match the type of the constant at `index`.
@roblox/global/debug.setconstant.code_sample:
local function foo()
    print("Goodbye, world!")
end

debug.setconstant(foo, 3, "Hello, world!")
foo() --> Hello, world!

@roblox/global/debug.setstack.documentation: Sets the register at `index` in the stack frame `level` to `value`. The type of `value` must match the type of the register at `index`.
@roblox/global/debug.setstack.code_sample:
local function foo()
    -- Change the first value from "Goodbye, world!" to "Hello, world!"
    return "Goodbye, world!", debug.setstack(1, 1, "Hello, world!")
end

print(foo()) --> Hello, world!

@roblox/global/debug.setupvalue.documentation: Sets the upvalue at `index` in the function or level `func` to `value`.
@roblox/global/debug.setupvalue.code_sample:
local function somethingImportant()
    print("Goodbye, world!")
end

local function foo()
    somethingImportant()
end

debug.setupvalue(foo, 1, function ()
    print("Hello, world!")
end)

foo() --> Hello, world!

@unc/global/readfile.documentation: Returns the contents of the file located at `path`.

@unc/global/listfiles.documentation: Returns a list of files and folders in the folder located at `path`. The returned list contains whole paths.
@unc/global/listfiles.code_sample:
local function descend(path, level)
    level = level or 0
    for _, file in ipairs(listfiles(path)) do
        print(string.rep("  ", level) .. file)
        if isfolder(file) then
            descend(file, level + 1)
        end
    end
end

descend(".")

@unc/global/writefile.documentation: Writes `data` to the file located at `path` if it is not a folder.

@unc/global/makefolder.documentation: Creates a folder at `path` if it does not already exist.
@unc/global/makefolder.code_sample:
makefolder("folder")
writefile("folder/file.txt", "Hello, world!")
print(readfile("folder/file.txt")) --> Hello, world!

@unc/global/appendfile.documentation: Appends `data` to the end of the file located at `path`. Creates the file if it does not exist.
@unc/global/appendfile.code_sample:
writefile("services.txt", "A list of services:\n")

for _, service in ipairs(game:GetChildren()) do
    if service.ClassName ~= "" then
        appendfile("services.txt", service.ClassName .. "\n")
    end
end

@unc/global/isfile.documentation: Returns whether or not `path` points to a file.

@unc/global/isfolder.documentation: Returns whether or not `path` points to a folder.

@unc/global/delfile.code_sample:
writefile("file.txt", "Hello, world!")
print(isfile("file.txt")) --> true

delfile("file.txt")
print(isfile("file.txt")) --> false

@unc/global/delfolder.code_sample:
makefolder("folder")
print(isfolder("folder")) --> true

delfolder("folder")
print(isfolder("folder")) --> false

@unc/global/loadfile.documentation: Generates a chunk from the file located at `path`. The environment of the returned function is the global environment. If there are no compilation errors, the chunk is returned by itself; otherwise, it returns nil plus the error message. `chunkname` is used as the chunk name for error messages and debug information. When absent, it defaults to a random string.
@unc/global/loadfile.code_sample:
writefile("file.lua", "local number = ...; return number + 1")
local func, err = loadfile("file.lua")
local output = assert(func, err)(1)
print(output) --> 2

@unc/global/dofile.documentation: Attempts to load the file located at `path` and execute it on a new thread. Note: Some executors may provide the file name to the top-level vararg of the file (`...`).

@roblox/global/isrbxactive.documentation: Returns whether the game's window is in focus. Must be true for other input functions to work.

returns.documentation: True if the game window is in focus.

@r/global/mouse1click.documentation: Dispatches a left mouse button click.

@roblox/global/mouse1press.documentation: Dispatches a left mouse button press.

@roblox/global/mouse1release.documentation: Dispatches a left mouse button release.

@roblox/global/mouse2click.documentation: Dispatches a right mouse button click.

@roblox/global/mouse2press.documentation: Dispatches a right mouse button press.

@roblox/global/mouse2release.documentation: Dispatches a right mouse button release.

@roblox/global/mousemoveabs.documentation: Moves the mouse cursor to the specified absolute position.
@roblox/global/mousemoveabs.code_sample:
-- Wait for the game window to be selected
while not isrbxactive() do
    task.wait()
end

local size = workspace.CurrentCamera.ViewportSize

for i = 0, 50 do
    local x = math.sin(i / 50 * math.pi * 2) / 2 + 0.5
    local y = math.cos(i / 50 * math.pi * 2) / 2 + 0.5
    mousemoveabs(x * size.X, y * size.Y)
    task.wait(0.05)
end

@roblox/global/mousemoverel.documentation: Adjusts the mouse cursor by the specified relative amount.
@roblox/global/mousemoverel.code_sample:
-- Wait for the game window to be selected
while not isrbxactive() do
    task.wait()
end

for i = 0, 20 do
    local x = math.sin(i / 20 * math.pi * 2)
    local y = math.cos(i / 20 * math.pi * 2)
    mousemoverel(x * 100, y * 100)
    task.wait(0.05)
end

@roblox/global/mousescroll.documentation: Dispatches a mouse scroll by the specified number of pixels.

@roblox/global/fireclickdetector.documentation: Dispatches a click or hover event to the given `ClickDetector`. When absent, `distance` defaults to zero, and `event` defaults to `"MouseClick"`. Possible input events include 'MouseClick', 'RightMouseClick', 'MouseHoverEnter', and 'MouseHoverLeave'.

@roblox/global/getcallbackvalue.documentation: Returns the function assigned to a callback property of `object`, which cannot be indexed normally.

@roblox/global/getconnections.documentation: Creates a list of Connection objects for the functions connected to `signal`.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.documentation: An object representing a connection to a Roblox signal, returned by `getconnections`.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Enabled.documentation: A boolean indicating whether the connection can receive events.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.ForeignSta.documentation: A boolean indicating whether the function was connected by a foreign Luau state (i.e., CoreScripts).

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.LuaConnect.documentation: A boolean indicating whether the connection was created in Luau code.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Function.documentation: The function bound to this connection. Nil when `ForeignState` is true.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Thread.documentation: The thread that created the connection. Nil when `ForeignState` is true.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Fire.documentation: Fires this connection with the provided arguments.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Defer.documentation: Defers an event to connection with the provided arguments.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Enable.documentation: Allows the connection to fire if it was previously disabled.

@roblox/global/getcustomasset.documentation: Returns `rbxasset://` content id for the asset located at `path`, allowing you to use unmoderated assets. Internally, files are copied to the game's content directory. If `noCache` is false, the file will be cached, allowing subsequent calls to return the same content id.

@roblox/global/gethiddenproperty.documentation: Returns the value of a hidden property of `object`, which cannot be indexed normally. If the property is hidden, the second return value will be `true`. Otherwise, it will be `false`.

@roblox/global/gethui.documentation: Returns a hidden GUI container. Should be used as an alternative to CoreGui and PlayerGui. GUI objects parented to this container will be protected from common detection methods.

@roblox/global/getinstances.documentation: Returns a list of every Instance referenced on the client.

@roblox/global/getnilinstances.documentation: Like `getinstances`, but only includes Instances that are not descendants of a service provider.

@roblox/global/isscriptable.documentation: Returns whether the given property is scriptable (does not have the `notscriptable` tag). If `true`, the property is scriptable and can be indexed normally. If `nil`, the property does not exist.

@roblox/global/sethiddenproperty.documentation: Sets the value of a hidden property of `object`, which cannot be set normally. Returns whether the property was hidden.

@roblox/global/setrbxclipboard.documentation: Sets the Studio client's clipboard to the given `rbxm` or `rbxmx` model data. This allows data from the game to be copied into a Studio client.

@roblox/global/setscriptable.documentation: Sets whether the given property is scriptable. Returns whether the property was scriptable prior to changing it.

@roblox/global/checkcaller.documentation: Returns `true` if the function currently running was called by the executor. This is useful for metamethod hooks that behave differently when called by the game.
@roblox/global/checkcaller.code_sample:
local refs = {}

refs.__namecall = hookmetamethod(game, "__namecall", function(...)
	local self = ...
	local isRunningOnExecutor = checkcaller()

	if isRunningOnExecutor then
		if self == game then
			error("No __namecall on game allowed")
		end
	end

	return refs.__namecall(...)
end)

game:Destroy() --> Error "No __namecall on game allowed"

@roblox/global/clonefunction.documentation: Generates a new closure based on the bytecode of function `func`.
@roblox/global/clonefunction.code_sample:
local function foo()
	print("Hello, world!")
end

local bar = clonefunction(foo)

foo() --> Hello, world!
bar() --> Hello, world!
print(foo == bar) --> false

@roblox/global/getcallingscript.documentation: Returns the script (`BaseScript`) responsible for the currently running function.

@roblox/global/hookfunction.documentation:
Replaces `func` internally with `hook`, where `hook` will be invoked in place of `func` when called. Returns a new function that can be used to access the original definition of `func`.

Warning: If `func` is a Luau function (`islclosure(func) == true`), the upvalue count of `hook` must be less than or equal to that of `func`.
@roblox/global/hookfunction.code_sample:
local function foo()
	print("Hello, world!")
end

local fooRef = hookfunction(foo, function(...)
	print("Hooked!")
end)

foo() --> Hooked!
fooRef() --> Hello, world!

@roblox/global/iscclosure.documentation: Returns whether or not `func` is a closure whose source is written in C.

@roblox/global/islclosure.documentation: Returns whether or not `func` is a closure whose source is written in Luau.

@roblox/global/isexecutorclosure.documentation: Returns whether or not `func` was created by the executor.
@roblox/global/isexecutorclosure.code_sample:
print(isexecutorclosure(isexecutorclosure)) --> true
print(isexecutorclosure(function() end)) --> true
print(isexecutorclosure(print)) --> false

@roblox/global/loadstring.documentation:
Generates a chunk from the given source code. The environment of the returned function is the global environment. If there are no compilation errors, the chunk is returned by itself; otherwise, it returns `nil` plus the error message. `chunkname` is used as the chunk name for error messages and debug information.

Danger: Vanilla Lua allows `source` to contain Lua bytecode, but it is a security vulnerability. This is a feature that should not be implemented.
@roblox/global/loadstring.code_sample:
local func, err = loadstring("print('Hello, world!')")
assert(func, err)() --> Hello, world!

local func, err = loadstring("print('Hello")
assert(func, err)() --> Errors "Malformed string"

@roblox/global/newcclosure.documentation:
Returns a C closure that wraps `func`. The result is functionally identical to `func`, but identifies as a C closure, and may have different metadata.

Warning: Attempting to yield inside a C closure will throw an error. Instead, use the `task` library to defer actions to different threads.
@roblox/global/newcclosure.code_sample:
local foo = function() end
local bar = newcclosure(foo)

print(iscclosure(foo)) --> false
print(iscclosure(bar)) --> true

@unc/global/identifyexecutor.documentation: Returns the name and version of the current executor.

returns.documentation: The compressed data as a string.

@unc/global/lz4decompress.documentation: Decompresses `data` using LZ4 compression, with the decompressed size specified by `size`.

@unc/global/messagebox.documentation: Creates a message box with the specified text, caption, and flags. Yields until the message box is closed, and returns the user input code.

returns.documentation: The user input code (e.g., IDCANCEL, IDTRYAGAIN, IDCONTINUE).

@unc/global/queue_on_teleport.documentation: Queues the specified script to be executed after the player teleports to a different place.

@unc/global/request.documentation: Sends an HTTP request using the specified options. Yields until the request is complete, and returns the response.

@unc/global/setfpscap.documentation: Sets the in-game FPS cap to `fps`. If `fps` is `0`, the FPS cap is disabled.

@unc/globaltype/HttpRequest.documentation: A table defining the options for an HTTP request.

@unc/globaltype/HttpRequest.Method.documentation: The HTTP method to use. Can be `GET`, `POST`, `PATCH`, or `PUT`.

@unc/globaltype/HttpResponse.documentation: The response from an HTTP request.

@unc/globaltype/HttpResponse.StatusCode.documentation: The number status code of the response.

@unc/globaltype/HttpResponse.StatusMessa.documentation: The status message of the response.

@unc/globaltype/HttpResponse.Success.documentation: Whether or not the request was successful.

@roblox/global/getrawmetatable.documentation: Returns the metatable of `object`, bypassing the `__metatable` lock. This is identical to `getmetatable` but ignores the metamethod.

params.name: object
params.documentation: A table or userdata whose raw metatable you want to retrieve.

returns.documentation: The raw metatable of the object, or `nil` if it has none.

@roblox/global/hookmetamethod.documentation: Replaces a metamethod of an object with a hook function. The hook is called instead of the original metamethod. Returns a function that can be used to call the original metamethod. The hook function cannot yield or block the thread. Avoid calling the hooked metamethod from within the hook to prevent recursion.

params.name: object
params.documentation: The object (table or userdata) whose metamethod you want to hook.

params.name: method
params.documentation: The name of the metamethod to hook (e.g., "__index", "__namecall").

params.name: hook
params.documentation: The function that will replace the original metamethod.

returns.documentation: A reference to the original metamethod, which can be called to bypass the hook.

@roblox/global/getnamecallmethod.documentation: Returns the name of the method that triggered the current `__namecall` metamethod. This function is only useful inside a `__namecall` hook.

returns.documentation: The name of the method being called (e.g., "service", "GetService").

@roblox/global/getnamecallmethod.code_sample:
hookmetamethod(game, "__namecall", function(...)
    local method = getnamecallmethod()
    if method == "service" then
        error("Not allowed")
    end
    return ...
end)

@roblox/global/isreadonly.documentation: Checks whether a table or userdata is frozen (readonly). This is identical to `table.isfrozen` but also works on userdata.

params.name: object
params.documentation: The table or userdata to check.

returns.documentation: `true` if the object is readonly, otherwise `false`.

@roblox/global/setrawmetatable.documentation: Sets the metatable of an object, bypassing the `__metatable` lock. This works even if the object already has a metatable with a `__metatable` field.

params.name: object
params.documentation: The table or userdata whose metatable you want to set.

@roblox/global/setreadonly.documentation: Sets the readonly (frozen) state of a table or userdata. This is identical to `table.freeze`/`table.isfrozen` but works on any object.

params.name: object
params.documentation: The table or userdata to modify.

params.name: readonly
params.documentation: `true` to make the object readonly, `false` to make it writable.

@roblox/global/cache.invalidate.documentation: Deletes `object` from the Instance cache. Effectively invalidates `object` as a reference to the underlying Instance.
@roblox/global/cache.invalidate.code_sample:
local Lighting = game:GetService("Lighting")
cache.invalidate(game:GetService("Lighting"))
print(Lighting, Lighting == game:GetService("Lighting")) --> Lighting, false

@roblox/global/cache.iscached.documentation: Checks whether `object` exists in the Instance cache.
@roblox/global/cache.iscached.code_sample:
local Lighting = game:GetService("Lighting")
cache.invalidate(Lighting)
print(cache.iscached(Lighting)) --> false

@roblox/global/cache.replace.documentation: Replaces `object` in the Instance cache with `newObject`.

params.name: newObject
params.documentation: The new Instance object to replace `object` with.

@roblox/global/cache.replace.code_sample:
local Lighting = game:GetService("Lighting")
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

cache.replace(Lighting, Players)

print(Lighting) --> Players

@roblox/global/cloneref.documentation: Returns a copy of the Instance reference to `object`. This is useful for managing an Instance without directly referencing it.
@roblox/global/cloneref.code_sample:
local Lighting = game:GetService("Lighting")
local LightingClone = cloneref(Lighting)

print(Lighting == LightingClone) --> false

@roblox/global/compareinstances.documentation: Returns whether objects `a` and `b` both reference the same Instance.
@roblox/global/compareinstances.code_sample:
local Lighting = game:GetService("Lighting")
local LightingClone = cloneref(Lighting)

print(Lighting == LightingClone) --> false
print(compareinstances(Lighting, LightingClone)) --> true

@roblox/global/getgc.documentation: Returns a list of objects in the Luau garbage collector.

params.name: includeTables
params.documentation: Whether or not to include tables in the list. If false or omitted, tables are excluded.

returns: A list of objects (functions, userdata, or tables) currently tracked by the garbage collector.

@roblox/global/getgenv.documentation: Returns the custom global environment of the executor. It can be used to add global functions or share variables between scripts.
returns: A table representing the executor's global environment.
@roblox/global/getgenv.code_sample:
-- Prevent a script from being run twice
if getgenv().__IS_LOADED then
	error("This script is already loaded!")
end

getgenv().__IS_LOADED = true

@roblox/global/getloadedmodules.documentation: Returns a list of ModuleScripts that have been loaded.

params.name: excludeCore
params.documentation: Whether or not to exclude core modules from the list. If true, core-related modules are omitted.

returns: A list of loaded ModuleScript instances.
@roblox/global/getloadedmodules.code_sample:
local modules = getloadedmodules(true)

for _, module in ipairs(modules) do
	print(module:GetFullName())
end

@roblox/global/getrenv.documentation: Returns the global environment of the game client. It can be used to access the global functions that LocalScripts and ModuleScripts use.
returns: A table representing the game client's global environment.
@roblox/global/getrenv.code_sample:
-- Prevent scripts in PlayerScripts from being required
local refs = {}
local bannedScripts = game:GetService("Players").LocalPlayer.PlayerScripts

refs.require = hookfunction(require, function(...)
	local module = ...
	if
		typeof(module) == "Instance"
		and module:IsA("ModuleScript")
		and module:IsDescendantOf(bannedScripts)
	then
		error("You are not allowed to require this module!")
	end
	return refs.require(...)
end)

@roblox/global/getrunningscripts.documentation: Returns a list of scripts that are currently running.
returns: A list of LocalScript or ModuleScript instances that are executing.
@roblox/global/getrunningscripts.code_sample:
local scripts = getrunningscripts()

for _, object in ipairs(scripts) do
	print(object:GetFullName(), "(" .. object.ClassName .. ")")
end

@roblox/global/getscriptbytecode.documentation: Returns the raw Luau bytecode of the given script.

@roblox/global/getscriptclosure.documentation: Generates a new closure using the bytecode of the script.

params.name: script
params.documentation: The script to recreate as a function.

returns: A function that, when called, executes the scripts bytecode.
@roblox/global/getscriptclosure.code_sample:
local module = game:GetService("CoreGui").RobloxGui.Modules.Common.Constants

local constants = getrenv().require(module)
local generatedConstants = getscriptclosure(module)()

print(constants == generatedConstants) --> false
for k, v in pairs(constants) do
	print(k, typeof(v) == typeof(generatedConstants[k])) --> true
end

@roblox/global/getscripthash.documentation: Returns a SHA384 hash of the script's bytecode. This is useful for detecting changes to a script's source code.
returns: A SHA384 hash string of the scripts bytecode.
@roblox/global/getscripthash.code_sample:
local animate = game:GetService("Players").LocalPlayer.Character.Animate
local hash = getscripthash(animate)

task.delay(1.5, function ()
	animate.Source = "print('Hello World!')"
end)

for i = 1, 5 do
	task.wait(0.5)

	local newHash = getscripthash(animate)

	if hash ~= newHash then
		print("The script has changed!")
		hash = newHash
	else
		print("The script has not changed.")
	end
end

@roblox/global/getscripts.documentation: Returns a list of every script in the game.
returns: A list of all LocalScript and ModuleScript instances present in the game.
@roblox/global/getscripts.code_sample:
local scripts = getscripts()

for _, object in ipairs(scripts) do
	print(object:GetFullName(), "(" .. object.ClassName .. ")")
end

@roblox/global/getsenv.documentation: Returns the global environment of the given script. It can be used to access variables and functions that are not defined as local.
returns: A table representing the scripts global environment.
@roblox/global/getsenv.code_sample:
local animate = game:GetService("Players").LocalPlayer.Character.Animate
local environment = getsenv(animate)

for k, v in pairs(environment) do
	print(k, v, "(" .. typeof(v) .. ")")
end

@roblox/global/getthreadidentity.documentation: Returns the identity of the current thread.
returns: A number representing the current thread identity (security context).

params.name: identity
params.documentation: The new thread identity (a number from 010, though values 28 are most common).
